lineage.Process: FeatureClassToFeatureClass "Database Connections\AGIO.sde\STRUC.PUBLIC_SCHOOLS_DOE" H:\Temp\01_a "Public School.shp" # "LEA LEA true true false 8 Text 0 0 ,First,#,Database Connections\AGIO.sde\STRUC.PUBLIC_SCHOOLS_DOE,LEA,-1,-1;NAME NAME true true false 40 Text 0 0 ,First,#,Database Connections\AGIO.sde\STRUC.PUBLIC_SCHOOLS_DOE,NAME,-1,-1" # "H:\Temp\01_a\Public School.shp"

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.6.1500

descript.abstract: Public Schools in the East Arkansas Planning and Development District.The subject file contains location information for 2008-2009 public schools (K-12) in the state of Arkansas. The locations were verified by Arkansas Department of Education staff and officials in the local areas.
descript.purpose: Use cases for how the data could be used: 1. A list of resources for the name of schools in East Arkansas and their corresponding Local Education Agency ID. 2. Join this data with Arkansas Department of Education data by LEA ID and explore spatial distribution of rankings, teacher salaries, and full-time enrollment numbers.
descript.supplinf:
The subject file contains public schools K-12 listed in the 2008-2009 Arkansas Education Directory. School names and LEA's which reside in districts that have been consolidated or annexed have been updated to reflect the current information as of September 1, 2007. K-12 Public Schools opening in the 2007-2008 school year have been added.
All locations were verified utilizing the best available orthos. Personnel and data resources were used to locate each of the schools. Refer to the source column to determine how the school was verified.
A number of school locations may not appear on a structure, when viewed on the 2006 Digital Ortho Quarter Quads. These schools have been built since Jan-April 2006 timeframe.

overview.dsoverv:
This dataset contains the location, local education agency (LEA), and name of every school in the Arkansas Department of Educations AS-IS (Arkansas School Information Site) databases.
This dataset was created through a cooperative effort between the Arkansas Geographic Information Office and the Arkansas Department of Education.
overview.eaover: All entities and attributes were derived from Arkansas Department of Education's Arkansas School Information Site and Statewide Information System databases.

Distribution of these data is intended for information purposes and should not be considered authoritative for engineering, legal and other site-specific uses.

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.6.1500
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Use cases for how the data could be used: 1. A list of resources for the name of schools in East Arkansas and their corresponding Local Education Agency ID. 2. Join this data with Arkansas Department of Education data by LEA ID and explore spatial distribution of rankings, teacher salaries, and full-time enrollment numbers.
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Public Schools in the East Arkansas Planning and Development District.

The subject file contains location information for 2008-2009 public schools (K-12) in the state of Arkansas. The locations were verified by Arkansas Department of Education staff and officials in the local areas.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: This data was downloaded from the Arkansas Geographic Information Office, while originating out of the Arkansas GeoStor, and edited by Civic Analytics to contain only those schools in the East Arkansas Planning and Development District.

procstep.procdesc:
This data set was created through a series of steps designed to acquire the correct location and the proper Local Education Agency (LEA) for each school campus.
Spatial data sets used to access the location of each school included: 2000 - 2003 Arkansas Digital Ortho Photography, Arkansas Centerline File Data, Arkansas Highway and Transportation Department City Boundaries, and Arkansas Highway and Transportation Department County Boundaries.
The first step required the geocoding of an Arkansas Department of Education list of schools. The list of schools supplied contained the name, physical address, and LEA for each school campus. MapInfo MapMarker was used to perform the geocode. Schools that did not geocode to the street level where assigned to the zip code centroid. This file was named "geocoded_schools". Abbreviations were replaced with the full spelling of each element. Each element was also edited to reflect proper case. For example: HALL HIGH SCHOOL was edited to Hall High School.
The second step required the extracting of schools from the United States Geological Survey data set "Geographic Names Information System". All historic schools, colleges, universities, and private schools were deleted. The file was named "gnis_schools". This file was determined to have a more accurate spatial location than that of the geocoded file. However the gnis_school layer did not have the LEA (required for database linkages) assigned to each school.
The geocoded_schools data set was joined to the gnis_school data set based on school name. The joined dataset was then exported to a geo-database. This file was named geocodedgnis_schools.
The geocodedgnis_schools attributes were then scrubbed. Database queries were used to determine schools that did not join. LEA's were added to schools that did not join properly. Schools found in the geocodedgnis_school data set that were not in the ADE full list of schools (LEA_Name table extracted from the 2004 AS-IS database) were deleted.
The geocodedgnis_schools data set was then joined to the LEA_Name table extracted from the 2005 AS-IS database. Database queries were used to identify LEA's that did not join.
The schools that did not exist in the geocodedgnis_schools were added to the centroid of the proper school district and the proper LEA was added.
A number of schools in the geocodedgnis_schools data set were observed as having the exact same name. These schools received a single LEA code during the original join. Database queries were used to determine schools that contained the same LEA. Schools containing the same LEA were scrubbed and the proper LEA was assigned.
The Arkansas Geographic Information Office worked one on one with the Arkansas Department of Education Facilities Manager to edit the spatial location and LEA's of each school. Spatial locations of all schools were verified by The Arkansas Department of Education or local officials.

pubinfo.pubplace: Little Rock, Arkansas, United States of America

attracc.attraccr:
All school names and Local Education Agency Codes were reviewed by Arkansas Department of Education staff to ensure each school value was assigned properly
A number of database joins were made between the data set and the 2005-06 AS-IS Database. The joins were accomplished using the LEA. Each join was successfully accomplished.

dataqual.complete: All school locations were reviewed by Arkansas Department of Education staff to ensure each school location was placed properly. Additionally, local officials and datasets were used to verify locations.

horizpa.horizpar: Accuracy of each school location is equivalent to that of the digital ortho photography for that area created through the Arkansas Digital Ortho Program; following National Digital Ortho specifications (90% of the well defined points are within 10 meters

qhorizpa.horizpae: All school locations were placed on the digital ortho photography, in the center of one of the main school building.

dataqual.logic: Consistency is maintained throughout the data set.
